full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 119 of 261 1280 LC6Cmax3 Kate - cross 1 Q. And what is the exceptional circumstance that you use to renew your visa? 2 A. It's actually an -- it's an extraordinary ability. 3 Q. And what is your extraordinary ability that you put forth 4 in support of your visa? 5 A. The last one? 6 Q. Yes. 7 A. The last one was related to music, but not actually 8 songwriting or anything. It was coaching. 9 Q. So anyone -- 10 A. Singing, coaching. 11 Q. So anyone who can claim to be an unlicensed music coach 12 would be eligible for that type of visa 13 MS. POMERANTZ: Objection, your Honor. 14 THE COURT: Sustained. 15 Q. Prior to using music, what else did you use to indicate 16 that you are exceptional? 17 A. I don't -- I'm not clear on what you're asking, what did I 18 use to indicate that I was exceptional. 19 Q. What did you state was the basis of you being exceptional? 20 A. My -- the basis has always been music-related and it's 21 evolved over time as my work has evolved. 22 Q. But other than you being an unlicensed music coach, you are 23 not in the music business? 24 A. I don't -- I don't understand. You're saying other than -- 25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012870
